item.title: Cops to Congress: We need logs of Americans' text messages
item.description: Cops to Congress: We need logs of Americans' text messages http://t.co/nJmlMDiU
item.content:encoded: Cops to Congress: We need logs of Americans' text messages http://t.co/nJmlMDiU State and local law enforcement want wireless providers to store detailed information about your SMS messages for at least two years -- in case they're needed for future criminal investigations. Read this article by Declan McCullagh on CNET News. Link - Trackbacks

I appreciate you, Mr. President! * Anesha Smith 8 hours ago If we have to go off the fiscal cliff to reset everything with fairness then lets do that, hopefully it will only be temporary! * fernando orellana 8 hours ago I didn't know that the White house was making computers! ;) * michael 8 hours ago Nice MacBook mod :-) * Catherine Cook 8 hours ago Please do not give into the Republican obstructionism this time. item.title: Pope's Twitter handle @Pontifex; will be Q&A
item.description: Pope's Twitter handle @Pontifex, first Tweet Dec. 12 will be a Q&A format: http://t.co/O9H4IZaC - VW
item.content:encoded: Pope's Twitter handle @Pontifex, first Tweet Dec. 12 will be a Q&A format: http://t.co/O9H4IZaC - VW VATICAN CITY (AP) — Pope Benedict XVI will start tweeting in six languages from his own personal handle (at)Pontifex on Dec. 12.The Vatican said Monday the pope will be using a question and answer format in his first Tweet, focusing on answering questions about faith — in 140 characters.The pope sent his first tweet last year from a Vatican account to launch the Holy See's news information portal. The Vatican's communications adviser Greg Burke told a press conference that the handle (at)Pontifex was chosen for the pope's personal account because it not only means pope in Latin, but also bridge-builder, suggesting unity. How often will the pope tweet? Burke said, "as often as he wants."The Vatican has been increasing its presence in social media to try to spread the faith, particularly among the young. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: ap.org

item.dc:creator: nytimes.com

item.title: Sheldon Adelson Spent Far More On Campaign Than Previously Known
item.description: Willard getting his kneecaps busted in 5, 4, 3... http://t.co/7mYzvJSd
item.content:encoded: Willard getting his kneecaps busted in 5, 4, 3... http://t.co/7mYzvJSd WASHINGTON -- Casino magnate Sheldon Adelson vowed to spend as much as $100 million to defeat President Barack Obama and help the GOP take control of Congress. According to two GOP fundraisers with close ties to the Las Vegas billionaire, he made good on that promise -- and then some. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com
